Class MutationBoss1

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
Core.ActiveActor
Core.ActiveActorDestructible
Core.FighterPlane
Entities.Boss
Entities.MutationBoss1
All Implemented Interfaces:
Destructible, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class MutationBoss1 extends Boss
Represents the first mutation of the Boss enemy in the game. This class defines unique behaviors, including custom movement patterns and firing projectiles in multiple directions.

  • Property Summary

  • Field Details

    • IMAGE_PATH

      private static final String IMAGE_PATH
      The file path to the image resource representing the visual appearance of the mutation entity. This image is used for rendering the entity in the game.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • HEALTH

      private static final int HEALTH
      The initial health of the entity. This value represents the total health points the entity starts with.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • VERTICAL_VELOCITY

      private static final int VERTICAL_VELOCITY
      The vertical velocity of the entity. This value defines how fast the entity moves vertically.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • Y_POSITION_UPPER_BOUND

      private static final int Y_POSITION_UPPER_BOUND
      The upper boundary for the entity's vertical position. Prevents the entity from moving above this value.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • Y_POSITION_LOWER_BOUND

      private static final int Y_POSITION_LOWER_BOUND
      The lower boundary for the entity's vertical position. Prevents the entity from moving below this value.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MAX_FRAMES_WITH_SAME_MOVE

      private static final int MAX_FRAMES_WITH_SAME_MOVE
      The maximum number of frames during which the entity can move in the same direction. After reaching this limit, the movement direction is reset or shuffled.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • BOSS_FIRE_RATE

      public static final double BOSS_FIRE_RATE
      The firing rate for the boss entity. This value defines the probability (0 to 1) of firing a projectile during each frame.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • movePattern

      private final List<Integer> movePattern
      A list representing the movement pattern of the entity. Contains values that define the vertical movement during each frame.

    • indexOfCurrentMove

      private int indexOfCurrentMove
      Tracks the current position or step in a sequence of moves or actions. This variable is used to determine the index of the current move being processed or executed.

    • framesInCurrentMove

      private int framesInCurrentMove
      Tracks the number of frames spent in the current movement. Used to manage movement patterns and determine when to change the move direction.

  • Constructor Details

    • MutationBoss1

      public MutationBoss1()
      Constructs a new instance of MutationBoss1 with default properties. Initializes movement patterns and health.

  • Method Details

    • initializeMovePattern

      private void initializeMovePattern()
      Initializes the movement pattern of the boss. Adds vertical movement options (up, down, stop) and shuffles them for random behavior.

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition()
      Updates the boss's position based on its current movement pattern. Ensures that the boss stays within the screen boundaries and switches movement periodically.
      Overrides:
      updatePosition in class Boss

    • updateActor

      public void updateActor()
      Updates the actor's state, including position and health bar.
      Overrides:
      updateActor in class Boss

    • fireProjectile

      public void fireProjectile(javafx.scene.Group root, List<ActiveActorDestructible> enemyProjectiles)
      Fires projectiles in multiple directions with predefined velocities. Adds the projectiles to the scene and an enemy projectiles list.
      Parameters:
      root - the group to which projectiles will be added.
      enemyProjectiles - the list tracking all enemy projectiles.

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage()
      Handles the boss taking damage. If health reaches zero, it is marked as destroyed and removed from the scene.
      Specified by:
      takeDamage in interface Destructible
      Overrides:
      takeDamage in class Boss
